_header: Crown of thorn so sharp and keen
Note:
Ringler Jr. (1992)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler TM 337.
_description: Fragment of a poem on Christ’s passion and pleading — six lines in couplets

NYPLDrexFr4180.Transcription:
…[c]rowne of thorne so scharpe & kenethrow my heyde [
                    ][ ]rust trulyAnd all was man[ ][ ]redeme whom I dyd make so
                    bewtefully[ ]ell & slye was euer thrawnAgaynst my [ ][ ]
                    ȝytt were I lothe þat þu shuld spyll…
NYPLDrexFr4180.Note:
Portions of pages cut away to fit as endleaves to seventeenth-century
                    song book, with musical notation.
NYPLDrexFr4180.Editions:
Stevens,  John,
                        ed.  
             Music and Poetry in the Early Tudor Court.
         London: Methuen, 1961: 426.
